channel.title: BBC News - UK Politics
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Plan B would be triggered by NHS pressure, Sajid Javid says
item.description: It comes as government scientists warn of a jump in Covid hospital admissions if rules are not tightened.

item.title: China's ambassador Zheng Zeguang banned from UK Parliament
item.description: A row erupts after Zheng Zeguang is told he is not welcome while sanctions against MPs are in place.

item.title: Inflation: Price rises see record jump as food costs soar in August
item.description: The UK inflation rate hit 3.2% in the year to August, according to the latest official figures.

item.title: Boris Johnson warns Covid risk remains as he unveils England's winter plan
item.description: But he says the UK is better placed to tackle the disease as he outlines England's winter plan.

item.title: Michael Gove criticised over racist and homophobic language in student speeches
item.description: Recordings emerge of Michael Gove using using racist, sexist and homophobic language 30 years ago.

item.title: Social care won't get money it needs, warns Jeremy Hunt
item.description: The Conservative former health secretary tells MPs there is a risk the NHS will "gobble up" all the funds.

item.title: Brexit: Checks on goods imported from the EU delayed again
item.description: The government blames Covid and supply chain difficulties as it puts back changes.

item.title: Dominic Raab urged to block new Rwandan diplomat amid human rights concerns
item.description: A Rwandan diplomat has been accused of detaining a government critic portrayed in the film Hotel Rwanda.

item.title: Love Island star Amy Hart says she got death threat from 13-year-old
item.description: Amy Hart tells a House of Commons inquiry on influencer culture that social networks should do more.

item.title: Boris Johnson's mother, Charlotte Johnson Wahl, dies aged 79
item.description: Charlotte Johnson Wahl died "suddenly and peacefully" in London on Monday, the PM's family says.

item.title: Covid booster vaccine rollout to begin across UK next week
item.description: Experts say a single dose of Pfizer should be offered at least six months after a second dose.

item.title: Welsh Labour and Plaid Cymru in Senedd co-operation talks
item.description: Parties confirm discussions on whether they can work together in the Welsh Parliament.

item.title: Do new laws mean an early general election is likely?
item.description: Boris Johnson is close to taking back powers to set the date of the next general election when he chooses.

item.title: Universal Credit: Cut is two hours extra work for claimants, says Therese Coffey
item.description: The minister's claim over the end to the £20 uplift is disputed and called an "insult" by Labour.

item.title: NI Protocol: Lord Frost 'concerned' over EU comments
item.description: The UK's Brexit minister says it would be a "mistake" to think the UK will not trigger Article 16.

item.title: Covid: More than 300,000 suspected of breaking quarantine rules
item.description: It comes as the prime minister prepares to announce his winter Covid plan, including for booster jabs.

item.title: COP26: UK still lagging on climate policy, report says
item.description: UK policies will deliver a quarter of emissions cuts needed, say campaigners ahead of the COP26 summit.

item.title: TUC says 'proper pay rise' would fix shortages problem
item.description: Higher wages for workers is key to building a strong economic recovery, says Frances O'Grady.

item.title: Priti Patel: Labour demands probe after home secretary meets hotel boss
item.description: The party says she has "questions to answer" after attending a lunch without civil servants present.

item.title: Has Scotland moved closer to a second independence referendum?
item.description: Nicola Sturgeon says "democracy must prevail" - but critics suggest the independence issue is stuck in "Groundhog Day".

item.title: Five looming Welsh battles from boundaries review
item.description: Some of the big implications from plans to redraw Westminster's political map in Wales.

item.title: TUC: Jobs at risk if UK fails to hit carbon emissions target
item.description: Trade bodies and unions say the UK is slipping behind other nations on green investment.

item.title: 9/11 anniversary: Queen tells Biden the victims are in her prayers
item.description: After sunset, 67 candles were lit to remember British victims as part of remembrance events in the UK.

item.title: MP Nigel Adams filmed swearing at Mr Stop Brexit Steve Bray
item.description: Nigel Adams defends his response to campaigner Steve Bray accusing him of harassing politicians.

item.title: Sturgeon: No indyref2 until all Covid restrictions lifted
item.description: The SNP leader says Scots will not be asked to vote until they no longer have to "limit or restrict their behaviour".

item.title: Brexit: EU 'not looking for political victory' on protocol
item.description: Maros Sefcovic ends his two-day visit to Northern Ireland saying he wanted a "win-win" for all.

item.title: MI5: 31 late-stage terror plots foiled in four years in UK
item.description: The terror threat to the UK remains "a real and enduring thing", the head of the security service says.

item.title: Sajid Javid: 'We need to avoid unsustainable pressure on the NHS'
item.description: There will be "no single trigger" for bringing back coronavirus restrictions during winter, Sajid Javid says.

item.title: Chris Whitty on those 'peddling untruths' on Covid vaccines
item.description: Many who try to discourage others from the vaccine “know they are peddling untruths” says England’s chief medical officer.

item.title: Ex-Love Islander Amy Hart on online abuse and trolling
item.description: Amy Hart says social media users should be required to verify their identities by using an NI number.

item.title: Covid: Boris Johnson on Covid plans and restrictions
item.description: Protecting the NHS from being overwhelmed "has to remain the objective" and there are "all sorts of data" being looked at says the PM.

item.title: TUC: Starmer on working with unions on fire and rehire
item.description: Labour and the trade unions have an "obligation to unite and work together" says Sir Keir Starmer.

item.title: Will Boris Johnson’s plan for the NHS work?
item.description: The prime minister believes new funds will tackle the Covid backlog - but refuses to set targets.

item.title: Social care: Will people still have to sell their homes?
item.description: In 2019, the Conservatives pledged no-one should have to sell their home to pay for their care.

item.title: National Insurance: What’s the new Health and Social Care tax and how will it affect me?
item.description: A new health and social care tax is being introduced, Boris Johnson has announced.

item.title: Universal credit £20 drop: 'I'm used to hunger pains'
item.description: Under 25s are losing the biggest percentage of their income when the payments go down in October.

item.title: Patrick Harvie and Lorna Slater: Who are the new Green ministers?
item.description: Patrick Harvie and Lorna Slater are the first Green politicians to hold ministerial office in the UK.

item.title: Universal credit: When will the £20 increase stop?
item.description: The government has confirmed the £20 boost will end in the autumn.

item.title: Lib Dem leader Ed Davey wants to target Tory heartlands
item.description: Smashing Tory dominance in the party's traditional areas is Liberal Democrats leader Ed Davey's plan. Can it work?

item.title: Levelling up: The seaside town debating what change is needed
item.description: As a report says levelling up plans must consider local views, people in Rhyl debate the changes needed.

item.title: Afghanistan: Who originally supported Trump's deal with the Taliban?
item.description: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace now calls it a "rotten" deal but supported it at the time.

item.title: Sent to Halifax: One town's asylum story
item.description: What life is like for asylum seekers in a Yorkshire town - and what locals think about accepting more.

item.title: Woke: Compliment or criticism, it is now fuelling the culture wars
item.description: The surprising history of a term increasingly thrown around in UK political debate.

item.title: Afghanistan: Why can't the UK hold Kabul airport without the US?
item.description: The US and UK have different timetables for the effort to evacuate people from Afghanistan

item.title: Who is Dominic Raab?
item.description: A profile of the foreign secretary, as he comes under fire for his handling of the Afghanistan crisis.

item.title: Boris Johnson feels MPs' anger during Afghanistan debate
item.description: After a year of flat debates, a full Commons proved harder for the PM to navigate, writes Jessica Parker.
